sections.heading: Who Can Open
points: A single adult
Joint account (up to 3 adults) - Joint A or Joint B
A guardian on behalf of a minor
A guardian on behalf of a person of unsound mind
A minor above 10 years in his own name
Note: Any number of accounts can be opened

sections.heading: Deposits
points: Account type available for 1 year, 2 year, 3 year, and 5 year tenures
Minimum deposit: Rs. 1000 and in multiples of Rs. 100, no maximum limit
Interest payable annually; no interest on unpaid due interest
Annual interest can be credited to savings account on request
Investment under 5-year TD qualifies for Section 80C of Income Tax Act, 1961

sections.heading: Maturity
points: Deposit repayable after completion of 1/2/3/5 years from account opening (as applicable)

sections.heading: Extension of Account
points: On maturity, TD account can be extended for original tenure
Extension allowed within: 6 months for 1-year TD, 12 months for 2-year TD, 18 months for 3/5-year TD
Extension request can be submitted at account opening
Extension also allowed post maturity via application form and passbook
Interest rate at maturity will apply to extended period

sections.heading: Premature Closure of Account
points: No withdrawal allowed before 6 months from date of deposit
If closed after 6 months but before 1 year: PO Savings Account interest rate applies
If closed after 1 year (for 2/3/5-year TD): interest is 2% less than applicable TD rate for completed years; PO Savings interest for incomplete year
Premature closure by submitting application form and passbook at Post Office

sections.heading: Pledging of TD Account
points: TD account can be pledged or transferred as security via application with pledgee acceptance
Pledging allowed to: President of India, Governor, RBI, Scheduled Banks, Cooperative Societies/Banks, Corporations, Govt. Companies, Local Authorities, Housing Finance Companies

sections.heading: Note
points: As per National Savings Time Deposit Rules 2019
